page.title: 13BROAD SQR SCHOOL,LIVERPOOL
page.content: {BROAD SQUARE PRIMARY SCHOOL WAS FIRST {OPENED IN MARCH 1928.}THE SCHOOL WAS MADE OF GREEN WOOD.IT WAS ONE STOREY HIGH AND VERY LONG.THERE WERE FIFTY PEOPLE IN A CLASS SO THAT MEANT THAT THEY WERE VERY SQUASHED.ON{JUNE {6TH,1959,THE OLD SCHOOL WAS BURNT {DOWN.}THE CHILDREN HAD TO BE BUSSED DAILY TO CRAIGHURST SCHOOL UNTIL THE NEW SCHOOL WAS BUILT.THE SCHOOL THAT WE GO TO TODAY IS BUILT OF BRICK.IT HAS LARGE WINDOWS AND IS TWO STOREYS IN HEIGHT.IT HAS TWELVE CLASSROOMS(SIX ON EACH FLOOR), PLUS CLOAKROOMS, TOILETS,THE HEADMASTERS OFFICE,THE SECRETARY'S OFFICE AND A HALL WHICH WE USE FOR P.E. AND FOR DINNERS.THE SCHOOL IS BUILT IN THE SHAPE OF A LETTER'L' WITH A LONG CORRIDOR OUTSIDE THE DOWNSTAIRS CLASSROOMS.OUTSIDE IS A PLAYGROUND A SMALL GRASSED AREA.THIS IS ALSO USED BY THE INFANTS.
